About Me

I am a game developer with my area of expertise being programming. As of right now, I am employed as a C# backend developer near Cologne at Vetsoft.One. I have developed several university game projects in small teams of four, smaller side projects, and three Game Jam titles.

I enjoy working on frontend visual and interaction systems just as much as I enjoy designing and implementing backend game systems. Because I tend to automate processes and keep repetitive work off of my back I also enjoy creating editor tools for myself and others in my teams to ease development and keep projects clean.

I really enjoy working in teams and I am a very sociable and communicative person. I'm always open to meeting new people and I like to help others wherever I can. I have experience with leading a small team of four people and I am able to work on my own or with other programmers side by side.

Employment

Vetsoft.One GmbH - Fullstack Software Developer

August 2022 - Present

When I first started out at Vetsoft.One I was mainly tasked with fixing smaller bugs and taking on small tasks inside the software. This quickly developed into more complex tasks which ranged from creating whole new views using the ASP.NET Core Blazor framework to creating back-end code that would manage database queries and data handling througout the whole software.

I am currently the one solely responsible for importing customer data into our software using a WPF based tool that I have created. The tool uses a mixture of SQL database queries, XML reading and writing and CSV file handling.

During my stay at Vetsoft.One GmbH I have acquired or refined several skill:
  • Deepened my knowledge in the WPF framework
  • Full creation process and maintenance of an import tool
  • Expert knowledge of the C# programming language
  • In depth knowledge of SQL and the Microsoft Server Management Studio suite
  • Data handling using CSV, XML and JSON file formats

Envision Entertainment GmbH - Tool Development Intern

November 2021 - March 2022

The internship at Envision Entertainment was a mandatory module for the completion of my Bachelors degree and during my stay at the company I was tasked with Tool development for the self developed in-house game engine.
  • Acquired beginner knowledge with of the WPF framework
  • Developed an Asset Creation Wizard by myself
  • Several bug fixes for the in-house game engine
  • Took part in several code architecture meetings
  • Tasked with designing the Tool's UI/UX flow by myself

Education

University of Applied Sciences in Darmstadt

Animation & Game - September 2017 - Present

The course of studies encompasses character design and storytelling, 2D and 3D animation, game development and programming. Over seven semesters, students work in a practical and interdisciplinary way to acquire the wide range of technical, conceptual and design skills needed for the development and production of animated films, series and games.
  • Three games created in a team of four
  • One solo developed game
  • Two Programming courses (Game Development)
  • Two Technical Art courses
  • Two Production Management courses
  • Several courses covering Legal issues, Game Design, Animation and Drawing

Mission Insignia

In Mission Insignia two players work together in a coop VR puzzle game to overcome the unforeseen crisis of an explosion that is threatening the success of the mission. Inspiried by the real life lunar mission, Apollo 13, the two players take on the roles of ground control and astronaut. While ground control must instruct the astronaut on how to restore power inside the capsule the astronaut must inform ground control about the situation and together they must avert the failure of the oxygen supply.

C# Unity Virtual Reality Team University

IMCognito

IMCognito is 2.5D spy game in which you take on the role of an undercover Stasi informant working for the Ministry of State Security. You are tasked with keeping an eye on your neighbours and report any suspicious or anti government behaviour to your higher ups, but whether you follow said orders is up to you. Earn the government's rewards and goodwill if you do so, or risk your own hide by secretly covering up for your neighbours.

C# Unity Team University

Deranged

A 2D coop puzzle game in which one player takes on the role of a chosen one that roams around the levels and the other that of a god that can manipulate the levels by rotating them and seeing objects the other player cannot. The two of them must work together to solve puzzles and complete levels.

University Website

C# Unity Solo University

Forsaken Adventures

Tired of slaying even the most gruesome monsters in a single strike, a ridiculously over-powered sword fighter decides that a job change is badly needed. Drop your hard-earned gear, forget your powerful skills and level down in this reversed dungeon crawler!

C# Unity Team University

Headless Chicken

You take contol of a chicken that has lost its head and your task is to get it back. On your way you can find different objects that can serve as a temporary hat and unlock unique abilities to further progress in the level. Smash or climb walls or use a zip line to get to your goal in this weird chicken platformer.

Itch.io link

C# Unity Blender Team GameJam

Parameters

A clicker rpg that is completely devoid of graphics and breaks down the rpg genre in a minimalistic way. Complete quests, gather money and experience and collect keys to unlock more quests and bosses.
